info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:44PM CDT until June 10 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WASHITA...NORTHEASTERN JACKSON...WESTERN KIOWA... EASTERN GREER AND SOUTHEASTERN BECKHAM COUNTIES... At 1143 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Hobart to near Martha, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Altus, Hobart, Mangum, Granite, Sentinel, Blair, Lone Wolf, Roosevelt, Gotebo, Rocky, Martha, Willow, Friendship, Altus Air Force Base, Retrop, Warren, Humphreys, Tom Steed Reservoir, Brinkman and Hester. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
